Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - if you're in Berlin, stay here!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just fab. In a good location close to Zoo Station and the zoo itself plus all the shops on the Ku'dam. Easy to reach all the historical bits of the city from here via the S-Bahn etc.The hotel is modern and the rooms are enormous - we stayed in the Ballade - with fantastic showers and good TV and mini kitchen facilities. Huge walk in wardrobe if you need it too. Really can't overemphasise what good value this place is. Stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Goethe87: still good, but with a few problems to sort out.”
Reviews.Author: Elwall
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Goethe87 a few years ago, and i rated it 5 stars. This time, as you see, it's down to 4. Yes, it's still good value and the apartments are modern and very pleasant and, obviously, it's still well-located. However, they were clearly having issues with the housekeeping. We stayed for 5 nights and, NOT ONCE, was the apartment serviced properly. The problems ranged from the major - NO servicing at all one day - to the minor - the removal of a set of towels, leaving one set for 2 people. Additionally, a little more friendliness from the front desk would be nice. One last point: we had not realised that the building is not airconditioned - and a fan doesn't make it. We'd still stay there next time but I'd hope that the housekeeping issues had been rectified by then.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot praise this enough!”
Reviews.Author: Maeght
Reviews.Content: Just the best! Well laid out large room ( the perfect space), bathroom with state of the art shower, totally functional kitchen area. It It is the first time that I have ever cooked a meal in hotel room and been more than happy to eat in. Shop for ingredients and cheap excellent German in the local store down the road and you need not go out every evening looking for places to eat. Stay indoors and watch the local TV. The place was so delightful it makes me want to go back to Berlin just so that I can stay at Goeth87 and cook spaghetti again!. Very helpful staff. I cannot think of a single negative thing to say about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves the great reviews but ignore the photos on their own website!”
Reviews.Author: tiggerandpooh
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at Goethe 87, but be careful when you book: The “Elfchen” is NOT the type of apartment they show in the photo on the website above the description of Studio Elfchen. The Elfchen is simply a very nice hotel room with a little kitchenette in the entrance to the room. There is no sofa and no dining table, but there is a little desk and a small square table in a little nook in the corner, suitable for one. We raised this point when we arrived and were immediately upgraded to the “Ballade” (I have added photos of both). The Ballade has a good size dining table, armchair, and a big walk in wardrobe plus a good size kitchenette with microwave, hob, fridge, toaster, coffee maker & kettle. We also had big French windows which added to the feeling of luxury and space. Some tea & coffee, sugar, salt & pepper is provided. Umbrellas are also provided for guests so no need to take up space in your case! The décor is great – modern with a boutique hotel feel. It was also spotlessly clean. The bed, which is 2 twin mattresses, is not particularly luxurious, rather hard and with very thin duvets, but the hotel was warm so this wasn’t too much of a problem. You only get one thin pillow too, so perhaps bring your own! Along these lines we felt the towels were a bit thin and worn, which didn’t match the luxurious décor and boutique style bathroom (a ‘wellness’ shower with massage jets – fabulous!). However, this didn’t detract from the quality of our stay, which we felt to be extremely good value for money. The gentleman on reception was very helpful, albeit he pops out for a cigarette break quite frequently leaving a “back shortly” notice on the door! But he is only gone for a few minutes, which was handy as he was no where to be seen when we arrived! Breakfast is about 14 euros, but we chose to use the supermarket (about a ten minute walk away) and cater for ourselves, although the breakfast room looked very trendy! The total journey from Berlin Schoenefeld airport to the hotel is approx 1 and half hours. From platform 13 take the S9, (direction Pankow), change at Ostkreuz and from platform 4 take the S3 (direction Spandau). It is then an easy 10 min walk from Zoologische garten station. The hotel is situated on a quiet street in the lovely area of Charlottenburg, full of old bookshops, and traditional crafts such as shoemakers, framers, tailors and a beautiful old fashioned perfumerie. There are plenty of cosy or modern cafes and restaurants on the doorstep, we only wish we’d had longer to try them all out!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelingbiz
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with this hotel. It even had a kitchenette and was overall clean and friendly. The location is fantastic, lots amenities close by and good transport links. There is even a yoga studio just across the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Berlin Charlottenburg”
Reviews.Author: Fernleigh1
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here in mid-December. The room was a large studio, overlooking an interior courtyard. Very contemporary (albeit spare) furnishings. Comfortable space with king bed, "fainting" sofa, table and chairs (good for work and eating), fully equipped kitchenette, and nice bathroom (walk-in shower, no tub). Everything was immaculate and in good order. Only real issue was the so-so WiFi service; signal was not strong and throughput was sluggish. Staff were very professional and accommodating. The hotel is just a few steps off a major street with quick bus access to Zoo Bahnhof, Charlottenburg has lost a bit of its charm, but there are good shops and restaurants close by, including many attractions at Savignyplatz. Would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and value”
Reviews.Author: sarahhannah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located and very comfortable. It is very well prices. Breakfast is extra but it is not hard to find places to eat quickly and inexpensively. We would go back to this hotel and highly recommend it. Quite near Zoo Station which is a central Berlin subway station as well as excellent shopping including the KeDaWee department store.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Scotch
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Berlin on business for a conference. The hotel has a good location to both food and public transportation. The rooms are nice with a kitchen and mini-frig. There is no air conditioning, but that seems to be pretty standard in Europe. The breakfast included with the stay is excellent, but the hours of availability could start earlier and end later. The internet access is poor. You will need to be either in the hallway, stairwell or in the hallway of the 2nd floor (this is where the wireless router is located) for you to have adequate signal consistency to do any work. I would recommend this hotel for personal travel, but if your business travel requires access to the internet, this is not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Room great, but not so the service!”
Reviews.Author: MrsDSomerset
Reviews.Content: The room and location were as expected...very good. Some handy restaurants nearby...die Filmbuhne just around the corner was great. Good local food and atmosphere at Dicke Wirtin too. It's difficult to say much about the service, as we didn't really get any! We arrived late in the evening, which the hotel knew, to find the entry code we'd been given was the wrong one. It took quite a while to get the invisible security person to let us have another one in order to get into our room. The next day, we found the safe wouldn't work. It was Easter Monday and the "technical man" wasn't there, so we were told it would be sorted the following day. We phoned the next morning to be told "Give me a moment", then the receptionist hung up. That was the last we heard about getting it fixed, and we didn't have any further contact with the staff until the day we checked out. The chap on duty then was pleasant enough, but when we returned in the evening to collect our bags, we found they'd been left in an unlocked room for the day. So, all in all, hardly the service you'd expect really.

Reviews.Title: “I get dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: JoannaMilano
Reviews.Content: I have stay in Goethe during New Years Eve for 5 nights. I have booked 2 studio ODE for our friends too. The studio are very comfortable,spacious, clean . The breakfast was good nothing special.The location was very good near Hauptbanhof station and metro.The area was quite and nice.The staff wasn't very friendly. The only problem we had is that they haven't change the sheets for all 5 nights we stay there.When I asked them I never took an answer. The value for money is high I quess because we pay 200 Euro per night for each studio. At the end when we check out they didn't say not even thank you. I get dissapointed because I have read alot good things about Goethe but.... I don't know if next time I will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what is says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: itzard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here alone for just one night but was really impressed. Great rooms (apartments) with all the mod cons. A private parking garage and o great location. The building itself is rather boring, but who cares. The rooms are great. I had a Ballade Studio. Little kitchen (fully equiped), double bed with two separate matrasses, just the way I prefer. Nice bathroom with good walk-in-shower. Wonderfull chaise lounge. My room was at the back of the hotel. Nice and quiet. The staff is a bit surly and not very welcoming, but thay are efficient and the tc is way to small for the size of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel close to the necessities”
Reviews.Author: aussieboy7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Goethe87 for 3 nights in October and had a wonderful stay. I booked because of the reviews on Trip Advisor (which by the way were accurate for every place we stayed throughout Europe). Because it has a kitchenette we were able to save money by cooking our own breakfasts and dinners and there is a supermarket two blocks away opposite Zoologischer Garten station, which is about a 5-7 minute brisk walk from the hotel. Check-in was a breeze and our room was clean and modern. The only negative was the light from the street coming through under the blinds of the window but we just put a towel under it and it was fine. The bathroom and shower were excellent but we couldn't get the safe in the room to work but that didn't really bother us. Because it is close to the train station, it is easy to get around and we all bought 3-day passes for all the public transport which worked out well. For the price that we paid for the room (99 euros) this was an absolute bargain compared to other places we stayed in Europe and you get a lot for your money. Overall an excellent stay and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Goethe 87 Bliss”
Reviews.Author: traveller3012
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed 3 nights and they were all WONDERFUL. We both travel a lot and stay in lots of apartments and hotels and this was by far the best in any country I've been in lately. The rooms are beautiful, the service is friendly and the location is really convenient for sight seeing and dining out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peterobina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than 10 minutes walk to Zoologicagarten station and was a very pleasant surprise. We were upgraded to a large 1 bedroom suite, quiet ,modern and all the facilities of a top hotel. The shower had 6 outlets, nice sized kitchen and the walk-in robe was as large as many hotel rooms. All of this for less than 100 eoros!

Reviews.Title: “Great Goethe87”
Reviews.Author: rgel46
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect! My wife and I have stayed in many hotels, but Goethe87 certainly has captured our attention as being amongst the top. Goethe87 was fantastic from the moment we arrived at 9 AM after a long overnight flight and they let us check in right away. .This hotel is certainly beyond the WOW factor.. Location- The location is fabulous. Gives you the atmosphere of being in a boutique hotel. It is a classy hotel on a quiet street with near transportation and wonderful restaurants, and gives you the atmosphere of being in a boutique hotel. Amenities: Amenities is perfect and modern, and bathroom is very special. Staff- The best words of appreciation should go to Goethe87’s manager Robert Novacic who brought the personal touch to our wonderful stay. He was very responsive and tried his best to make our trip to Berlin very memorable. Mr. Novacic, who was fluent in English, helped us with all directions and advised us on attractions, restaurants, food and customs. We were very grateful for his care and service. They were above and beyond on our imagination. The ownership of this hotel can be proud of such a manager. Robert makes this place very execptional. The bottom line: if we are lucky enough to pass through Berlin again we know where we will want to stay – at Goethe87 Robert

Reviews.Title: “i could live at the Goethe87”
Reviews.Author: Elwall
Reviews.Content: The Goethe87 Hotel in Berlin was well-reviewed on Tripadvisor, and my wife and i decided to give it a go for the one night we were in the city. We just wish that we could have stayed longer. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk from Zoo station in the beautiful area of Charlottenburg, or 10 minutes from the Savignyplatz S-bahn station. The entrance is on the 1st (or, for you Americans, 2nd) floor. It is not a full-service hotel (no minibar, whoopee) but is more an apartment hotel. From the friendly check-in to the beautifully appointed and spotlessly clean apartment with its tea and coffee-making facilities to the plethora of nearby restaurants, we enjoyed the whole experience. No, breakfast was not included, but a coffee and pastry at a nearby cafe compensated for that. Certainly, we were upgraded, but the ultramodern and stylish fittings would have been the same throughout the hotel, of course. Really, apart from the lack of breakfast (which we knew about) we could not find fault with the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great neighborhood, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bob086
Reviews.Content: After reading the rave reviews, we selected this hotel for our four night stay in Berlin. Our room was immaculate and the wellness shower was a special treat after walking all around Berlin. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, however, there were several wonderful cafes nearby, as well as some bakeries. The staff was extremely accommodating with information. The hotel in located in Charlottenburg, a great area for shopping, don't miss the KaDeWe department store's gourmet food on the top floor. Out of this world! This hotel was very reasonably priced and was a lot larger than you would get in NYC for twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Goethe87 Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndyB11
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from three nights at this excellent hotel. It is well situated in a pleasant and relatively quiet part of the city but with many nice restaurants and shops nearby. There are also S and U bahn stations only a short walk away. The room we had was large, light, airy, spotlessly clean, well appointed and attractively decorated. The showers, as many other reviewers have already stated, are out of this world, being by far the best I have ever had the pleasure of using. The staff were all friendly and helpful and spoke good English. The breakfast we had in a modern and very pleasantly decorated room on the ground floor was also of a high standard with a wide choice of good quality food and efficient service. I look forward to returning to this hotel at the earliest opportunity and would not hesitate in recommending it to anyone else looking for a very good quality hotel in the charming and fascinating city of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - so central and clean”
Reviews.Author: cadaques12
Reviews.Content: I am just back from spending five wonderful nights at this great hotel. I read the reviews of the hotel on Tripadvisor - and they were spot on. From the moment we checked in (and got a free upgrade) we knew we'd struck gold. The rooms are huge, light and airy. They were always spotless and are equipped with everything you could need - kitchenette, fridge, air con, dvd player, radio and different types of pillow. The showers are out of this world, they blast you from all directions. It is obviously well insulated as we never heard any noise at night. The location is superb too - minutes from main shops and five mins to U and S Bahn which takes you to all the sights. There is a GREAT Spanish place five mins walk away called Mar Y Sol. I would find it hard to believe anyone could be disappointed with this excellent, and for the centre of Berlin failry cheap, hotel. We WILL return!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the hotel”
Reviews.Author: reissaaja
Reviews.Content: Just came home from Berlin. I stayed in hotel Goethe87 in Charlottenburg for the weekend and liked the hotel a lot. It is an apartment hotel with very spacious, modern and clean apartments with a lot of light. The room faced a nice and quiet backyard, it was nearly like staying in countryside although the Kurfuerstendamm just about 500 meters away is. The area is very nice, with plenty of good restaurants in the Knesebeckstrasse round the corner. I had breakfast in my room, but it is also possible to have it in the hotel bistro downstairs or even to order a breakfast from there to the room. The personnel was also very nice. The only problem I had was with the towels in bathroom. One day they were not changed although I had put them on the floor. But after I had called the reception and asked for fresh towels, they were brought to the room in just 5 minutes and so it was not a big issue. For some people the location could also be a problem since it is located some kilometers from the area Mitte where many of the attractions are. But there is a U-Bahn and a S-Bahn station not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Shelley_in_rome
Reviews.Content: I booked Goethe 87 based on the great reviews I saw here on Trip Advisor, and was not disappointed! Had a great 3-night getaway with my husband in the mid-sized suite. We found the location convenient and quiet, the hotel itself clean and tastefully decorated, and the suite very comfortable. We were able to cook in the kitchenette and there was English-language news. We liked the neighborhood, cute shops, cafes, and a small organic grocery nearby, and were able to walk (about 5-10 mins.) to public transport. The "well being" shower was incredible and relaxing as others have mentioned. I highly recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Very plesant stay”
Reviews.Author: ronchen
Reviews.Content: You not only get an hotel room, you get a whole apartment for a very reasonable price. Great big room. stylish, clean with kitchen that has everything you need. We can only recommend this place. (only missing thing is a bathtub, but besides that even the bathroom is very nice)

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch for Studio Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PNWBOY
Reviews.Content: This "studio" hotel, with efficient kitchen and super modern amenities gets the highest ranking I could give an establishment. The service, albeit not a full-service hotel, was by far the most efficient and pleasant I have experienced. In a quiet, beautiful part of Berlin, it is an easy walk to the U and S Bahn. The shower is fantastic; the bed is very comfortable; the rooms are modern, crisp and clean; and our continental breakfast through room service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sanjoseKat
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin with a German friend and she chose this hotel for us. We could not have been happier. The hotel is clean, comfortable and modern. You are greeted with two green apples on your pillows and a free large bottle of water. Our room had a lovely little alcove with a desk overlooking the street. Perfect for writing postcards. And the shower! So many different shower heads shooting water from different directions. After a wonderfully long day of sightseeing, it was a great way to relax. We also had a small kitchen with a refrigerator and microwave. We took advantage of this by visiting a nearby market and stocking up on breakfast items, snacks and drinks. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. And the neighborhood is beautiful. Just steps away from the Zoo Station and the famous Kurfurstendam Shopping Street. Don't miss the KaDeWe Department Store. The largest on the continent. There are plenty of cafes nearby. Also, a few blocks down on the same street as the hotel is a wonderful little bookstore run by a Bostonian. It sells English language books for those of you who find you have run out of something to read during your stay. We enjoyed our stay so much that after four nights we hated to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Keen_Traveller_NI
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel/apartment to fit into a much needed relaxing break with my husband. The apartments are advertised as luxuary apartments and we were not disappointed. We booked a studio apartment and was pleasantly surprised at the size of the apartment - we did worry that it was just going to be a box, like most European accomodation but we did not feel at any point we needed extra space- we were there for 5 nights. The apartment had a walk-in wardrobe big enough to be a bedroom! The apartment itself was wonderful - well decorated(contempory-chic), had all the mod-cons i.e. LCD tv, dvd player, hob, microwave oven, coffee filter machine, safe, etc..... It was cleaned daily and as mentioned in other reviews, the shower/bathroom was absolutely fantastic! Location - The apartments are located within 10mins walk to the S-Bann ('Zoo' stop) and 5mins walk to one of the major shopping streets. It is surrounded by numorous eateries-greek, italian, chinese, vietnamese, thai,etc....not to mention bakeries, delicatessens supplying fresh breads/desserts/cakes/cheeses/hams etc... With the S-Bann being so close, it was relatively easy to get to once getting off the plane - there is a S-Bann station from the airport straight to the stop 'Zoo'. Value for money - Cost of apartment is not for the budget traveller but it is affordable - approx £80 per night. When compared to other hotel deals and consider what you are getting for your money, it is actually quite a good deal. Entertainment - Due to the time of year and the type of trip we wanted, we didn't really go partying in the evenings, but was quite happy spending our evenings in nearby restaurants enjoying a lovely meal. With its nearby public transport links, we were able to do all the sightseeing we wanted and was not left thinking we had missed anything. Would we recommend staying? Definitely yes!

Reviews.Title: “The Best of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Litlove39
Reviews.Content: I selfishly hesitated to write this review as I’m afraid the next time I go to Berlin, Goethe 87 will be sold out! My husband, my mother, her friend and I all stayed for a week at Goethe 87. It stands tall as the best deal we encountered in Europe, we all loved it. These hotel rooms are like small apartments and include their own doorbell, kitchenettes, and balconies. They are tasteful, sleek and appointed with the best features, such as Gaggenau stoves and refrigerators, gorgeous French doors that swing open or hinge at the bottom for a breeze, push-button shade closures and high-end fixtures throughout. Our room had a lovely view and was very quiet. The bathroom shower is a dream, equipped with a Grohe wellness apparatus that shoots water at you from various heights, culminating in a large rainshower head and a hand-held sprayer. The entire impression is Euro-style and upscale. There is daily cleaning service, despite the apartment schematic. There is free onsite laundry service and wireless internet, unheard of at their rate. The reception and Bistro staff were utterly professional and always helpful. They lent us an English book on what to do in Berlin, and when we couldn’t figure out the shower workings, someone came right to our room and demonstrated for us. They lent us an umbrella when it rained and even faxed for us. If we called for something, it was immediately addressed. We were very impressed. We did have a concern with the cleaning staff, but that was quickly rectified and apologized for. Goethe 87 is in what was once one of the most fashionable parts of town, Charlottenburg. The trend factor loss to the east is our gain in the west, as staying in Charlottenburg is now less expensive than say Berlin Mitte or nearer to the gate. Bearing in mind that Berlin had the best transportation system we encountered, anywhere you stay is accessible to the city centers, and Goethe 87 is surrounded by excellent shopping and varied restaurant choices. When you stay at Goethe 87 you feel you are absorbed into the lifestyle of Berlin. The post office is across the street, the apothecary is around the corner, the grocer is down the street and the Kurfurstendam is a few blocks away—life goes on around you as it would for a local; the environment is authentic Berlin. Berlin is a lush, fascinating, historic and vibrant city with an international flair, don’t bypass it, and get out to museum island! Surrounding the city are a multitude of relaxing parks, quaint lakeside towns (Tegel-am-see), and castle areas (don’t miss the Potsdam Palaces). There is an active art scene. I loved Berlin and Goethe 87 made it truly comfortable and memorable for our entire group. A++!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: robobok
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a quiet area of Berlin, Charlottenburg. It's on walking distance (10mins) of the Zoo Station and the Kurfurstendamm. The rooms are big. We booked a 35 square meter Studio Ballade for 98 euros per night. The studio's interior is very modern and looks brandnew. On first entrance, the hotel staff has left a nice green apple on top of your pillow. Other cool features: nice big windows that can be opened; an LCD tv; a nice kitchenette incl. micro wave and complete set of glasses, plates, etc. But the hottest of all features is the generous bathroom with wellness shower! God, we loved taking (long!) showers in this hotel. In fact it's a shower with 4 massaging water sources (whats that called in English? Shower heads?). Staff is very friendly and helpful too.

HotelInfo.Name: Apartmenthaus Goeth87
HotelInfo.Address: Goethestrasse 87, 10623 Berlin, Germany
